text: The time for peaceful compromise has long past. In order to fulfil your duties as a governor, you must eradicate those which threaten your domain, with force.

A tiger cannot cower in his den whilst his territory is threatened by another. Your lands were appointed for you to legally govern, and you cannot allow greedy warlords to take them from you. If diplomacy fails, more drastic measures will be needed.

You worry your neighbours think you a fool. Promises are being broken, and sworn deals are being discarded. Lest negotiations begin to break down, you must focus your administration towards defence. Recruit more soldiers, and consider replacing farming tools with spears and blades.
Your administration is a flexible one, with bias being shown to neither the dove of peace nor the tiger of war. You are poised to adapt to any issue that may arise, be it internal or external.

Although brigands and caitiffs continue to nip at your holdings, it is now time to de-escalate your military build up. Allow your soldiers to return to their fields for now, and concentrate your efforts on crop management and the flow of goods.

Even heinous and wicked foes can see reason with clever logic and reasoned debate. By making steps towards peace, you are bettering the realm for everyone, not only those under your direct governance. Allow the men in your domain to be fathers and farmers, not warriors.

Your dominion is prosperous and stable - and you will see it remain that way, not with your blade but with your words. Resources and food shall flow through your realm, and diplomacy shall keep your neighbours content.
[[b]] Jurisdiction [[/b]] can be increased by being vassalized and by having governors.
[[b]] Jurisdiction [[/b]] can be decreased by having armies that aren't garrisoned.
• Gained(Commandery) by being vassalized and governors.
• Standing armies cause it to lower(military).
In uncertain ages of disunity, an able administrator must be prepared to ready his people for war, as well as be a guiding hand in moments of peaceful respite.
